incident.description: Minor rear-end motor vehicle collision at low speed (approx 8 mph) in parking lot. No airbag deployment. Patient drove home from scene.

raw_text:
MEDICAL CLAIM REVIEW - CLM-2025-FL-009821

PATIENT: Robert M. Vasquez, DOB 09/22/1978, Member ID MEM-2025-88421
POLICY: PIP-FL-2025-44210, National Auto Casualty Insurance
DATE OF INCIDENT: 10/12/2025
DATE OF FIRST TREATMENT: 11/02/2025 (21 days post-incident)
DATE CLAIM FILED: 05/15/2026 (7 months post-incident)
TOTAL BILLED: $127,850.00

INCIDENT DESCRIPTION:
Patient reports minor rear-end motor vehicle collision in a parking lot at approximately 8 mph. No airbag deployment. No police report filed. Patient states he drove home from the scene without assistance. No emergency room visit. Patient waited 3 weeks before seeking any medical treatment, which is a significant gap between the reported minor incident and the initiation of an extensive treatment plan.

CLINICAL NOTES SUMMARY:

11/02/2025 - Initial Visit (Sunshine Spine & Recovery Center)
Patient presents with complaints of neck stiffness and intermittent low back pain. Physical exam: mild tenderness to palpation over cervical paraspinals. Full range of motion in all extremities. Neurological exam normal. Assessment: cervical strain (S13.4XXA), cervicalgia (M54.2), low back pain (M54.5). Plan: MRI cervical and lumbar spine ordered, begin physical therapy 3x/week, TENS unit prescribed, labs ordered.

NOTE: Documentation supports 99213 (moderate complexity) visit level. Billed as 99215 (high complexity). Clinical decision-making is straightforward for this presentation.

11/04/2025 - Imaging (Coastal Imaging Center)
MRI Cervical Spine: No acute abnormality. Mild degenerative changes C5-C6, age-appropriate.
MRI Lumbar Spine: Mild disc bulge L4-L5. No stenosis, no nerve root compression. Age-appropriate degenerative changes.
NOTE: MRI findings are unremarkable and inconsistent with the extensive treatment plan that follows.

11/05/2025 - Cardiovascular Stress Test (Sunshine Spine)
Cardiac stress test performed. Normal results. No cardiac symptoms were documented at any visit. This test appears medically unnecessary for a neck sprain diagnosis and represents a suspicious mismatch between the diagnosis and the procedure ordered.

11/10/2025 - Physical Therapy Begins
PT evaluation billed twice on same date (97161 AND 97163) - duplicate billing. Treatment plan: manual therapy, therapeutic exercises, mechanical traction, electrical stimulation - all billed per session, 3x/week for 16 weeks. This represents an unusually intensive and prolonged treatment regimen for soft tissue injuries from a minor low-speed collision.

Concurrent chiropractic treatment initiated at Tampa Bay Chiropractic Wellness on same dates as PT sessions at Sunshine Spine. Both chiropractic codes 98940 (1-2 regions) and 98941 (3-4 regions) billed on each visit - suspicious duplicate manipulation billing.

12/01/2025 - Pain Management Initiated (Advanced Pain Management Associates)
Facet joint injections begun (64493, 64494) - monthly for 6 months. No diagnostic medial branch block performed prior to therapeutic injections. No imaging confirmation of facet joint pathology. MRI showed only age-appropriate changes. Monthly pain management visits billed at 99215 (high complexity) but documentation shows brief 10-minute encounters.

LABORATORY CONCERNS:
Monthly CBC (85025), Basic Metabolic Panel (80048), Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (80053), and TSH (84443) ordered throughout treatment. Basic and comprehensive metabolic panels billed on same dates - clear unbundling. No clinical indication for repeated blood work or thyroid testing for a soft tissue injury. TSH testing for a neck sprain patient with no thyroid symptoms is medically unjustified.

MEDICATION CONCERNS:
Oxycodone 10mg TID prescribed for 16 weeks for soft tissue injury from a minor collision. This is inconsistent with standard treatment guidelines which recommend NSAIDs and conservative therapy. Extended opioid prescription for a low-speed MVA whiplash injury raises significant concerns.

MULTIPLE PROVIDER OVERLAP:
Three separate providers billing for overlapping services on same dates:
- Sunshine Spine & Recovery Center: PT, injections, labs, supplies
- Tampa Bay Chiropractic Wellness: Chiropractic adjustments (same dates as PT)
- Advanced Pain Management Associates: Facet injections, office visits

All three providers are located within a 2-mile radius and share the same referring physician (Dr. Elena Ruiz, NPI 1234509876). This pattern is consistent with coordinated provider networks commonly associated with medical fraud mills.

SUPPLY CHARGES:
$4,800 in supply charges (99070) over 16 weeks with no itemization. Standard practice requires itemized supply documentation.

DISABILITY EVALUATIONS:
Three work disability evaluations billed (99455) for a patient who is self-employed with no documented employer and no workers compensation claim on file. Medical necessity for disability evaluations is questionable.

SUMMARY OF CONCERNS:
1. Significant 3-week delay between minor incident and first treatment
2. Extensive 16-week treatment plan for minor soft tissue injuries from 8 mph collision
3. MRI findings do not support the intensity of treatment provided
4. Cardiac stress test with no cardiac symptoms - diagnosis-procedure mismatch
5. Duplicate PT evaluations billed same day
6. Duplicate chiropractic manipulation codes billed same visits
7. Lab unbundling - basic and comprehensive metabolic panels on same dates
8. Medically unnecessary labs (TSH for neck sprain)
9. 99215 upcoding - documentation supports lower visit levels
10. Opioid prescribing inconsistent with soft tissue injury severity
11. Three providers billing overlapping services on same dates
12. Shared referring physician across all providers within 2-mile radius
13. No police report for MVA claim
14. $4,800 in unitemized supply charges
15. Disability evaluations for self-employed patient with no workers comp claim
16. Claim filed 7 months after incident
17. Total billed $127,850 for parking lot fender bender
